name: modulate
content:
modulate verb [T]
(SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] to change the style, loudness, etc. of something such as your voice in order to achieve an effect or express an emotion: His gentle introductory tone modulates into a coach's pre-game pep talk.
[ I ] specialized to change from one musical key to another: Here we modulate from G major to A minor.

modulate verb [T]
(PLAN/PROCESS)
[ T ] formal to change something, such as an action or a process, to make it more suitable for its situation: An elected committee will meet monthly to modulate the council's energy policy.
